page.title: 19Trentham Childrens Games - 2
page.content: 4. Hide and Seek. One child is the seeker. The other children hide (anywhere in the street or garden) while the seeker counts slowly to a given number. The seeker then searches for the children. The last one found is the winner. The first one found is the new seeker. 5. Off Ground Tick. Same as (3) but any child standing off the ground is 'safe' and cannot be touched. 6. Line Tick. Variation of (3). When touched you join the chaser's team. The last one touched is the winner. 7. Hop Scotch. A numbered grid is drawn out with chalk on the ground. A stone has to be thrown on each numbered square in turn and the player hops over all the squares other than the one with the stone on it. If the stone goes onto the wrong square the players turn ends.
